intro: Bulbinella elata, commonly known as the golden bulbine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous root system. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow and orange. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in Mediterranean climates.
